intro: Ulex baeticus var. bourgaeanus, commonly known as the Spanish broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a shrub characterized by its yellow flowers and thorny stems, which are typical features of the Rhamnaceae family. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a pioneer species in ecological succession and its ornamental value in landscaping.
